title: 80,000 Hours: AI safety researcher career review
oneLiner: 80,000 Hours: AI safety researcher career review
whenToSuggest: Use when it aligns with the focus area goals.
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: DeepMind: “AGI Safety Course” (playlist)
oneLiner: A short, structured intro from DeepMind; good for people who prefer a “course vibe” over an explainer video.
whenToSuggest: Candidate likes structured learning and wants an intro under ~1 hour Candidate is skeptical and prefers institutional framing
whenNotToSuggest: Candidate wants the EA community’s strategy framing (use 80k reading alt instead)
firstSmallStep: Watch the first chunk and note: “which track feels more like me: technical vs governance/policy?”

title: Robert Miles: “Intro to AI Safety, Remastered”
oneLiner: A fast, widely-shared introduction that helps someone test whether AI safety is emotionally/intellectually compelling.
whenToSuggest: Candidate is curious but hasn’t tested AI safety at all Candidate prefers video and wants a quick “do I care?” pass
whenNotToSuggest: Candidate already has strong familiarity and wants deeper field granularity
firstSmallStep: Watch the video and write 5 bullets: “what risks felt real / what felt off / what questions I have.”
internalNotes: Good default when you want the resource to “advocate better than you can.”

title: 80,000 Hours job board (adjacent roles lens)
oneLiner: Useful second lens: sometimes the best “AI × animals” roles are in adjacent institutions (policy, research orgs, etc.).
whenToSuggest: Candidate is open to adjacent roles that still connect to animals Candidate wants higher-signal org discovery
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: ACE: “The impacts of AI on animal advocacy”
oneLiner: High-level map of where AI can help or harm animal advocacy; a good first “upsides + risks” framing.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a quick map and a balanced view (opportunities + failure modes) Candidate is unsure whether “AI × animals” is a real thing vs hype
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: AI×Animals Fellowship (8-week, remote)
oneLiner: Structured 8-week remote program for careers at the intersection of AI and animal welfare.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants structure, community, and a curated pathway Candidate is exploring “future-facing animal welfare” and wants a coherent map
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Animal Advocacy Careers job board (data/tech roles + org landscape)
oneLiner: Best place to see animal-advocacy orgs and spot tech/data roles that could connect to AI-for-animals.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants to translate interest into “what roles exist?” Candidate wants to learn org landscape fast
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: EA Opportunities (fellowships/programs/projects that aren’t “jobs”)
oneLiner: Good for finding programs/projects that are shorter or more structured than a job search.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants programs/fellowships more than job boards Candidate is earlier-stage and wants “entry ramps”
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Faunalytics: “AI and Animal Advocacy” (survey-style)
oneLiner: “How advocates already use AI” and what adoption looks like—useful for reality-checking.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a practical “what’s happening now in the field?” Candidate is interested in tooling, workflows, comms, research support
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Faunalytics volunteering (AI/tooling/research support lane)
oneLiner: Contribute to work that supports animal advocates; good if your contribution can be directly used (analysis, tooling, research support).
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a real-world contribution but doesn’t have specialized ML deployment skills Candidate can support research/tooling/analysis
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Felidae Conservation Fund: Volunteer AI/ML specialist (camera imagery)
oneLiner: Clear “measurable-good” project: help process real camera imagery used for animal population research.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants immediate hands-on contribution with real external users Candidate has ML deployment/testing skills (or is close) and wants a concrete task
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Futurekind AI Fellowship (12-week)
oneLiner: 12-week program to build skills and projects around AI for animal protection / environmental impact.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a longer, project-forward structured program Candidate wants to build or research in this space with mentorship/community
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: “Org-facing scoping note” using an RP AI-for-animals angle (externally useful)
oneLiner: A small research artifact meant to be used (shared with an org/funder), not a personal exercise.
whenToSuggest: Candidate needs action to stay motivated / wants proof-of-fit quickly Candidate can write clearly and wants a “bridge” from reading → doing impact Candidate has impostor syndrome and benefits from a bounded contribution
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Rethink Priorities: AI for human–wildlife conflict mitigations
oneLiner: Concrete examples of “AI-for-animals” in the real world; good for making it feel tangible.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants examples and mechanisms (not just “AI will change everything”) Candidate is pulled toward wild animals / conservation-adjacent routes
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Rethink Priorities: “How AI is affecting farmed aquatic animals” (series)
oneLiner: Deep “EA research-y” analysis of innovation → deployment → welfare impacts in aquaculture.
whenToSuggest: Candidate likes research depth and wants to understand mechanisms and intervention hooks Candidate is interested in farmed animals / food systems + technology
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: 80,000 Hours: Factory farming problem profile
oneLiner: Canonical EA-style overview of why farmed animal welfare matters and what levers exist.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a rigorous overview and “why this matters” Candidate likes reading and structured argumentation
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.
firstSmallStep: Skim + write 5 bullets: “most compelling / most questionable / what I’d want to learn next.”
internalNotes: Good “anchor reading” if they want the EA framing.

title: Jacy Reese: “Intro to effective animal advocacy” (YouTube)
oneLiner: A fast, approachable “field picture” overview that tests interest and gives a first map.
whenToSuggest: Candidate prefers video and wants a wide intro quickly Candidate is motivated but needs a clearer strategy map
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: 80,000 Hours: Biorisk research, strategy, and policy (career review)
oneLiner: A canonical EA-aligned overview of what biorisk work is, what roles look like, and how to assess fit. 80,000 Hours
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a grounded overview + realism about paths (research/policy/strategy) Candidate prefers reading/analysis to video
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: 80,000 Hours: Climate change problem profile
oneLiner: Canonical EA analysis + “best ways of working” section to translate interest → plausible paths. 80,000 Hours
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants “EA canonical view” and career-relevant framing Candidate likes structured, analytic writeups
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Founders Pledge: Climate Change Fund (via GWWC page)
oneLiner: A fund approach aimed at high-impact, evidence-based climate solutions (good for “pooled + research-backed”). Giving What We Can+2Founders Pledge+2
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a fund route rather than picking orgs Candidate wants “EA-ish climate giving” that’s portfolio-based
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Giving Green: effective climate giving
oneLiner: EA-principles-style evaluator for climate philanthropy (“where does money do the most?”). Giving Green+2Giving Green+2
whenToSuggest: Candidate is giving-inclined and wants a credible way to do it well Candidate wants a concrete lever while exploring careers
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Probably Good: Climate Change impact-focused overview
oneLiner: EA-ish overview that frames climate with an “impact-focused / what to do about it” lens. Probably Good+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a broad, EA-style orientation to climate as a cause area Candidate is deciding whether climate is “their thing” at all
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Probably Good job board (filtered to Climate Change)
oneLiner: Probably Good job board (filtered to Climate Change)
whenToSuggest: Use when it aligns with the focus area goals.
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Project Drawdown: Climate Solutions 101 (playlist)
oneLiner: Clear, concrete “what are solutions categories?” explainer; good for candidates who need video intuition fast. YouTube+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate prefers YouTube learning and wants a practical solutions map Candidate is early and needs an accessible entry point
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Project: Giving drive informed by Giving Green
oneLiner: A measurable-good project for action-first candidates: $ influenced / donated toward vetted opportunities. Giving Green+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate needs action to stay motivated or wants quick proof-of-fit Candidate is comfortable doing a small outreach or workplace match
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Terra.do: Climate Change — Learning for Action (12-week)
oneLiner: Structured “map the space + find your role” container; good for people who want guided exploration. Terra
whenToSuggest: Candidate likes cohorts and structure Candidate has bandwidth for a medium commitment exploration phase
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Work on Climate: Starter Packs + community
oneLiner: A guided way to explore climate sub-areas and see where your skills could fit. Work on Climate
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants “map the space” without committing to a long course Candidate is unsure which climate lane to test first
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Work on Climate: Volunteering
oneLiner: A structured way to get momentum via real volunteering across functions (including research/data analytics). Work on Climate+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate needs action early / wants proof-of-fit / wants a push Candidate wants a community container to stay motivated
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: 80,000 Hours: Health in poor countries (problem profile)
oneLiner: Canonical EA-style overview of global health: why it matters and what high-leverage work looks like. 80,000 Hours
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants an EA “map + why + how to help” Candidate likes structured reading
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: 80,000 Hours job board
oneLiner: EA-filtered job board; good for mapping orgs/role types and turning interest into a direction to test.
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants “what roles exist?” and recurring skill patterns
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: AIM: Entrepreneurship orientation video (<1h)
oneLiner: EA-endorsed “taste test” for entrepreneurship: helps someone quickly see what entrepreneurship-for-impact could look like, and whether it feels energizing.
whenToSuggest: Candidate is open to entrepreneurship (for-profit or nonprofit), even as a “maybe” Candidate wants a low-cost way to test fit without committing to a program Candidate is considering routes like “start a project,” “build a product,” or “launch an org”
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.
internalNotes: This works well as the “Experiment A” for entrepreneurship because it can advocate better than you can and gives the candidate a shared reference point before you explore heavier options (e.g., Charity Entrepreneurship).

title: Charity Entrepreneurship: Incubation Program
oneLiner: EA-aligned, high-commitment path to founding a cost-effective charity with training, research, and network. CE+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate is genuinely excited by founding Candidate can handle an intensive period + in-person component
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

goodFitIf: Selective + requires relocation (some in-person component) CE

title: GiveWell/GWWC YouTube: “GiveWell finds highly cost-effective charities — here’s how”
oneLiner: A short, EA-aligned explainer of the evidence mindset behind GiveWell-style giving. YouTube+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate is new to evidence-based charity evaluation Candidate prefers video
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: GiveWell: Top Charities Fund
oneLiner: Low-friction “default option” for giving to GiveWell’s highest-priority funding needs. GiveWell+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants a default giving option without picking a single org
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: GiveWell: Top Charities
oneLiner: Canonical evaluator for cost-effective global health giving; also a map of interventions that work now. GiveWell
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants concrete “what works?” Candidate likes evidence and cost-effectiveness
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Giving What We Can: 10% Pledge
oneLiner: A commitment mechanism for people who want giving to be a stable part of life. Wikipedia
whenToSuggest: Candidate explicitly likes commitment devices and is financially comfortable
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Giving What We Can: Global Health & Wellbeing Fund
oneLiner: Pooled giving allocated periodically using evaluator input (explicitly consults GiveWell). Giving What We Can
whenToSuggest: Candidate likes pooled funds and evaluator-guided allocation
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Peter Singer TED talk (via The Life You Can Save)
oneLiner: A values-first, EA-adjacent intro to “why and how to give” for people who resonate more with moral framing. The Life You Can Save
whenToSuggest: Candidate is values-motivated and wants the “why care?” framing Candidate is new to effective giving
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Project: GiveWell mini donation drive (measurable good)
oneLiner: Measurable-good project: money moved to highly cost-effective programs. GiveWell+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate needs action to stay motivated / wants proof-of-fit fast Candidate is donation-positive and can do small outreach
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: Project: GWWC Pledge Drive
oneLiner: Measurable-good community action: pledges taken / giving committed. Giving What We Can
whenToSuggest: Candidate likes community action and structured campaigns
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.

title: The Life You Can Save: Best Charities
oneLiner: EA-adjacent, evidence-backed recommended charity list with accessible explanations. The Life You Can Save+1
whenToSuggest: Candidate wants an approachable curated list and narratives
whenNotToSuggest: Skip if it does not match the person's constraints or interests.
